support_summary: A cysteine protease that directly interacts with LC3B to perform two essential, opposing functions: it proteolytically cleaves pro-LC3B to its active form (LC3-I) and later deconjugates LC3B-II from the autophagosome membrane to recycle it.

functions.cellular_process: Acts as a cysteine protease that recognizes and cleaves the C-terminal portion of newly synthesized pro-LC3B, exposing the glycine residue required for subsequent lipidation.
functions.effect_description: Generates the cytosolic, soluble form of LC3B (LC3-I), making it a viable substrate for the ATG7 activating enzyme.
biological_consequence: ATG4B protease binds and cleaves newly synthesized pro-LC3B → C-terminal peptide is removed, exposing Glycine-120 → Cytosolic LC3B-I is generated → LC3B-I becomes a substrate for the ATG7-mediated conjugation system → Enables autophagosome formation
specific_effects: Exposes the C-terminal glycine of LC3B, which is an absolute prerequisite for lipidation
Processes all mammalian LC3/GABARAP family members
ATG4B contains a C-terminal LIR motif important for efficient binding and cleavage of LC3 proteins

evidence.paper_title: The structure of Atg4B-LC3 complex reveals the mechanism of LC3 processing and delipidation during autophagy
evidence.authors: Satoo K, Noda NN, Kumeta H, Fujioka Y, Mizushima N, Inagaki F
evidence.relevant_quote: Atg4 has a critical function by both processing Atg8 precursors and deconjugating Atg8-PE. Here, we report the crystal structures of...HsAtg4B in complex with processed and unprocessed forms of LC3.

evidence.paper_title: LC3B Binds to the Autophagy Protease ATG4b with High Affinity Using a Bipartite Interface
evidence.authors: Fraser GL, Chojnacki M, Larsen DJ, Machleidt T, Schulte M, Roschitzki-Voser H, Zerbe O, Robers MB, Jeganathan S, Varelas X, Gsponer J, Moffat J, Kay LE, Plückthun A
evidence.relevant_quote: Human pro-LC3B contains 125 residues... ATG4b cleaves the last 5 residues of pro-LC3B to expose Gly120 for further lipidation.

functions.cellular_process: Removes LC3B-II from autophagosomal membranes by cleaving the amide bond between the C-terminal glycine of LC3B and the head group of phosphatidylethanolamine (PE).
functions.effect_description: Recycles LC3B from autophagosome membranes, allowing the protein to be reused for subsequent rounds of autophagosome formation and sustaining autophagic flux.
biological_consequence: ATG4B cleaves the amide bond between LC3B and PE on the autophagosome membrane → LC3B-II is deconjugated from the membrane → LC3B-I is released into the cytosol → Replenishment of the cytosolic LC3B-I pool → Allows for recycling of LC3B for sustained autophagic flux
specific_effects: Deconjugates LC3B-PE, releasing LC3B back into the cytosol
Regulates the amount of LC3-II on the autophagosome
Crucial for autophagosome maturation and fusion with lysosomes
Excess ATG4B can inhibit LC3 lipidation and autophagosome formation

evidence.paper_title: The protease activity of human ATG4B is regulated by reversible oxidative modification
evidence.authors: Pérez-Pérez ME, Zaffagnini M, Pérez-Martín M, Lemaire SD, Crespo JL
evidence.assay: In vitro cleavage assay, Western Blot
evidence.relevant_quote: Upon fusion with lysosomes, ATG4B can, in turn, deconjugate LC3-PE to release LC3-I to the cytoplasm for reuse.

evidence.paper_title: Classical autophagy proteins LC3B and ATG4B facilitate melanosome movement on cytoskeletal tracks
evidence.authors: Ramkumar S, Tatin F, Gangar A, Yadav S, Gokhale RS, Natarajan K, Rath S, Hema A
evidence.relevant_quote: Conversion of LC3-II form (16 kDa) to the nonlipidated LC3-I form (18 kDa) was observed, suggesting the role of ATG4B in LC3B delipidation on melanosomes.

evidence.paper_title: An Atg4B Mutant Hampers the Lipidation of LC3 Paralogues and Causes Defects in Autophagosome Closure
evidence.authors: Fujita N, Itoh T, Omori H, Fukuda M, Noda T, Yoshimori T
evidence.relevant_quote: One possible mechanism underlying this negative effect is that excess Atg4B efficiently deconjugates the LC3 from PE and decreases membrane localized LC3.

mechanism: Acts as a cysteine protease that recognizes and cleaves the C-terminal portion of newly synthesized pro-LC3B, exposing the glycine residue required for subsequent lipidation. Removes LC3B-II from autophagosomal membranes by cleaving the amide bond between the C-terminal glycine of LC3B and the head group of phosphatidylethanolamine (PE).
effect: Generates the cytosolic, soluble form of LC3B (LC3-I), making it a viable substrate for the ATG7 activating enzyme.; Recycles LC3B from autophagosome membranes, allowing the protein to be reused for subsequent rounds of autophagosome formation and sustaining autophagic flux.
summary: LC3B activates ATG4B to regulate pro-lc3b cleavage and lc3b-ii delipidation, ultimately affecting enables autophagosome formation.

evidence.paper_title: The structure of Atg4B-LC3 complex reveals the mechanism of LC3 processing and delipidation during autophagy
evidence.authors: Satoo K, Noda NN, Kumeta H, Fujioka Y, Mizushima N, Inagaki F
evidence.relevant_quote: Atg4 has a critical function by both processing Atg8 precursors and deconjugating Atg8-PE. Here, we report the crystal structures of...HsAtg4B in complex with processed and unprocessed forms of LC3.

evidence.paper_title: Crystal structure of human Atg4B, a cysteine protease essential for autophagy
evidence.authors: Sugawara K, Suzuki NN, Fujioka Y, Mizushima N, Inagaki F, Noda NN
evidence.relevant_quote: Human Atg4B is a cysteine protease essential for autophagy, which processes the C terminus of the ubiquitin-like modifiers, the LC3/GABARAP/GATE-16 family.
